intro: Faujasiopsis flexuosa subsp. erecta, commonly known as the upright faujasiopsis, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes a wide range of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
